Key Arguments: The bill would give ACMA excessive power to determine what constitutes misinformation and disinformation, making it the sole arbiter of truth.
The government would have the ability to penalize individuals for expressing views contrary to its own, while being exempt from these rules.
The bill threatens freedom of expression and speech, which are fundamental to democracy.
Historical examples show that what is considered true can change over time, highlighting the importance of open debate.
The bill contravenes international human rights agreements, specifically the ICCPR.
The COVID-19 pandemic demonstrated the dangers of government-controlled narratives and the suppression of dissenting opinions.
Main Themes: Historical perspective on truth and debate
Notable Quotes: The only way to discover truth and benefit society is to allow open debate and not silence debate as the proposed Bill would dictate.
If the proposed Bill passes into law, we would lose freedoms of expression, speech, conscience, thought and religion.
This would be a dark day for democracy, a right that our forefathers have fought hard to maintain.
